item.title: My First Website Attempt
item.dc:creator: @Sibor Sibor
item.description:
@Sibor wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

No… There will only be two play buttons on the main page, the rest will only have one.

Okay, doesn’t make sense but w/e, it’s your website.

html,
body {
  width:100%;
  background-image: url(../img/background.jpg);
  background-repeat: no-repeat;
  background-position: center;
  background-attachment: fixed;
}

Can be changed to:

html, body{
  background-image: url(../img/background.jpg) no-repeat center fixed;
}

Read full topic

item.title: My First Website Attempt
item.dc:creator: @Sibor Sibor
item.description:
@Sibor wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:2, topic:509741”]I only just skimmed over your code and picked up a few errors, you shouldn’t use tags anymore, use the css margin property with the auto; value to center your code in future. Remember, CSS is for styling and html is for semantics. Your image tag should have the alt=“alternate desc in here” attribute included in it as well. Your footer is hard to read, add a background to it. You should also add some styling to your links, do this with pseudo-classes this makes your links avoid clashing with that hideous purple colour they turn after being visited etc. You should also look into html5 structuring tags etc. There’s a lot of room for improvement here anyway, good job for a first try though!

You should also post your CSS code so we can try and help you improve that too.[/quote]

As to what Ruby said, you should probably make that image in the middle bigger, and maybe a slideshow if it already isn’t. Also, underneath it, there’s a play now link. There is no reason to have ‘play now’ twice on one page.

Anyways, not bad at all! Nicely done.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Website Attempt
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I only just skimmed over your code and picked up a few errors, you shouldn’t use tags anymore, use the css margin property with the auto; value to center your code in future. Remember, CSS is for styling and html is for semantics. Your image tag should have the alt=“alternate desc in here” attribute included in it as well. Your footer is hard to read, add a background to it. You should also add some styling to your links, do this with pseudo-classes this makes your links avoid clashing with that hideous purple colour they turn after being visited etc. You should also look into html5 structuring tags and the likes of those. There’s a lot of room for improvement here anyway, good job for a first try though!

You should also post your CSS code so we can try and help you improve that too.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Website Attempt
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

What do you guys think of it so far? What should I add/change to it?
I’m only temporarily using the background image until I find or create one.

[code=html]

FroznFury - Free MMORPG 
</head>
<body>
	<center>
		<a href="#"><img class="home" src="img/logo.png" width="624" height="67" alt="FroznFury - Free MMORPG"></a>
		<div id="nav">
			<ul id="Nav">
				<li id="nav00"><a href="#">home</a></li>
				<li id="nav01"><a href="#">forums</a></li>
				<li id="nav02"><a href="#">play now</a></li>
				<li id="nav03"><a href="#">highscores</a></li>
				<li id="nav04"><a href="#">membership</a></li>
				<li id="nav05"><a href="#">vote</a></li>
				<li id="nav06"><a href="#">download</a></li>
			</ul>
		</div>
		<div id="wowslider-container1">
			<div class="ws_images"><ul>
				<li><img src="img/slideshow/img_0.png" id="wows1_0"/></li>
				<li><img src="img/slideshow/img_1.png" id="wows1_1"/></li>
				<li><img src="img/slideshow/img_2.png" id="wows1_2"/></li>
				<li><img src="img/slideshow/img_3.png" id="wows1_3"/></li>
				<li><img src="img/slideshow/img_4.png" id="wows1_4"/></li>
			</ul></div>
			<div class="ws_shadow"></div>
		</div>
		<br>
		<a href="#" class="playnow">Play Now<span></span></a>
	</center>
</body>
<div id="footer">
	<center>
		<p>Copyright © <a href="#">FroznFury</a> 2013 All rights reserved. </br>
		<a href="http://www.runescape.com/">RuneScape</a>® is a trademark of <a href="http://www.jagex.com/">Jagex</a> © 1999 - 2013 Jagex, Ltd. FroznFury is not affiliated with Jagex.</p>
	</center>
</div>
[/code]

main.css

[code=css]html,
body {
width:100%;
background-image: url(…/img/background.jpg);
background-repeat: no-repeat;
background-position: center;
background-attachment: fixed;
}

#footer {
position:absolute;
bottom:0;
width:100%;
height:60px;
}

#container {
min-height:100%;
position:relative;
}

.playnow {
display: inline-block;
position: relative;
text-indent: -9999px;
width: 177px;
height: 50px;
background: url(…/img/playhover.png) no-repeat;
}

.playnow span {
position: absolute;
top: 0; left: 0; bottom: 0; right: 0;
background: url(…/img/playhover.png) no-repeat;
background-position: -177px 0;
opacity: 0;
-webkit-transition: opacity 1s;
-moz-transition: opacity 1s;
-o-transition: opacity 1s;
}

.playnow:hover span {
opacity: 1;
}[/code]

Read full topic
